Clip.Title: QUEST
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Covering developments in astronomy, biology, chemistry, engineering, the environment, geology, health, physics and the weather, Quest delves deep into subject matter that is often inaccesible to the public, to satisfy your curiousity and to illuminate the wonders of contemporary science and research.

Clip.Title: QUEST
Clip.Episode: Future Firefighters & Improving Life for Darfur Refugees
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Covering developments in astronomy, biology, chemistry, engineering, the environment, geology, health, physics and the weather, Quest delves deep into subject matter that is often inaccesible to the public, to satisfy your curiousity and to illuminate the wonders of contemporary science and research.

Clip.Title: HUMAN ORIGINS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: More than 285 early-human fossils and artifacts from 48 different countries tell the story our six-million-year-old history.

Clip.Title: COSMIC VISTAS
Clip.Episode: Windows to Other Worlds - Fountain of Creation
Clip.EpisodeSummary: How humans discovered the planets and how a few moving lights in the sky became a rich and complex solar system.

Clip.Title: COSMIC VISTAS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Mercury offers us a look at a solid world and the forces that shape it. With substantially more matter and a thicker atmosphere, Venus tells an even more complex story.

Clip.Title: MAGNIFICA ITALIA
Clip.EpisodeSummary: From Vasto to Barrea, between the Adriatic and the Appenines, there lie two Italian regions that are intimately linked and where tourism becomes discovery of small villages, National Parks and art cities.

Clip.Title: MAGNIFICA ITALIA
Clip.Episode: From Castel San Vincenzo to Sepino
Clip.EpisodeSummary: From Castel San Vincenzo to Sepino we continue our journey from the costal beaches to the mountain plateau of Gran Sasso and Majella and the National Park of Abruzzo, Lazio and Molise.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: High above the Gulf of St. Lawrence, one of the East Coast's hidden wonders lies below - the Magdalene Islands - offering some of the region's top beaches, grassy hillsides and spectacular cliff faces.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The Eastern Coastline of Nova Scotia is a living historical record of the centuries-old battle between the French and the English in the New World, along one of the Atlantic's most remote, hostile coastlines.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE

Clip.Title: HUMAN ORIGINS

Clip.Title: THE BIONIC VET
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Join the Bionic Vet and his staff as they tend to a puppy in shock, a police dog in agony and a cat about to take her first (reluctant) dip into the center's hydrotherapy pool.

Clip.Title: UNDERSEA EDENS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: One thousand miles off the southeast coast of Argentina sits the sub-Antarctic island of South Georgia in the Southern Ocean. About the size of Rhode Island, it's a breathtaking sight - long and narrow - shaped like a huge fractured whalebone. Massive glaciers, ice caps and snowfields cover about 75% of the island, but the land is far from desolate

Clip.Title: ANIMALS ALOFT
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Look into the archives of the National Air and Space Museum where incredible stories of thrilling adventures will be revealed, all with animals riding shotgun.

Clip.Title: MISSION PARADISE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Paradise is a myth, a dream, a utopia, a religious concept. But for many people, it is above all a quest. In the four corners of the planet, Mako, Amina Alaoui, Adolf Hvll, Ibis and Jean Delumeau have got a little closer to paradise than anyone else. This is their story, both a travelogue and their personal diaries.

Clip.Title: AERIAL FRANCE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Get an up close look at the beautiful French landscape from above and a taste of the rich culture on the stunning coasts.

Clip.Title: WALRUS TV - TORONTO: A CITY DEBATE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: A lively discussion about the future of Toronto and what makes a city great.

Clip.Title: WALRUS TV
Clip.EpisodeSummary: In depth vignettes on issues impacting modern Canadians, taken from the pages of the popular Magazine.

Clip.Title: STORIES FROM THE VAULTS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The Smithsonian is the largest museum complex in the world, housing more than 136 million objects. With so many varied things to see, any object may seem out of place, but there's nothing random about it. Host Tom Cavanagh takes a closer look at the seemingly "random" collections.

Clip.Title: STORIES FROM THE VAULTS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: What does the Smithsonian have to do with food? Join host Tom Cavanagh as he learns to cook Native American dishes with the executive chef of Mitsitam Cafe; experience the American coffee break with the National Museum of American History, and visit the National Museum of Dentistry.

Clip.Title: THE REAL STORY
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The biggest movie and TV franchise of all time, Star Trek spawned more than 700 TV episodes and twelve films. Creator Gene Roddenberry's vision of the future helped inspire today's scientists to develop the first scientific principles of teleportation, the creation of artificial intelligence, androids, and more.

Clip.Title: FREUD'S NAKED TRUTHS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Go behind-the-scenes of artist Lucian Freud , grandson of Sigmund and see rare footage of him in his studio, where supermodels, gangsters, and British nobility sat for his portraits.

Clip.Title: STORIES FROM THE VAULTS
